body.directions: Listen to the audio; then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following falls in the category indicated by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! 家务 jiāwù (chores) refers to chores around the house, such as doing laundry, cleaning, and of course, folding clothes.
body.incorrect: Not quite… Listen to the word in the audio again to identify its meaning. Then, review the words in the choices to see which one is the type of activity it refers to.

body.quiz: Where do you least likely see the item indicated by the word in audio?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 镜子 jìngzi means “mirror,” and you can easily find it in many places such as the bathroom or a clothing store, but maybe not in the forest.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word again. Identify its meaning and imagine in which of the places in the choices you will least likely see it.

body.textVersion: Audio for 淋浴间 línyùjiān (shower area)

body.quiz: In a household, which of the following items is most likely seen next to the item indicated in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 浴缸 yùgāng
options: Audio for 冰箱 bīngxiāng
Audio for 书架 shūjià
Audio for 炉子 lúzi
body.correct: Fantastic job! 淋浴间 línyùjiān means “shower area,” and you can most likely see it next to a 浴缸 yùgāng (bathtub). You might not want to see a 炉子 lúzi (stove) next to it.
body.incorrect: Almost there! Listen to the audio several more times to identify its meaning. Then, listen to the audios in the choices, and imagine these items next to the one indicated in the question. See which one fits most reasonably.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be best completed by the word in the audio?
body.answer: 她今天下午_____地板。 Tā jīntiānxiàwǔ_____ dìbǎn.
options: 我哥哥星期六_____衣柜。 Wǒ gēge xīngqīliù _____ yīguì.
我晚上_____电视。 Wǒ wǎnshàng _____ diànshì.
他每天上午_____衣服。 Tā měitiān shàngwǔ _____yīfu.
body.correct: Amazingly done! 拖 tuō means “to mop,” and it can best complete the sentence 她今天下午拖地板。 Tā jīntiānxiàwǔ tuō dìbǎn. (She mops the floor this afternoon.)
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again and consider its meaning. Then, review all four sentences in the choices to see for which one this word can fit most reasonably.

body.quiz: Which of the following bold type characters have the same initial as the word in the audio?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 扫 sǎo (to sweep) has the initial “s,” and so does the character 三 sān in 三明治 sānmíngzhì (sandwich).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the audio again and identify its initial. Then sound out the bold type characters in the choices to see which one has the same initial. Pay attention to the difference between tongue-curling initials such as “zh,” “ch,” “sh,” and non-tongue-curling ones such as “z,” “c,” and “s.”
